fi.grimripper.loww.tiles

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.tiles.Tile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Hex, Square

    public abstract class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the abstract super class for squares and hexes. Its purpose is to implement their common properties and generalize them in order to enable using the same movement radius algorithms for both squares and hexes. A tile has a specific type of terrain, such as mud or sand. In addition, it can have multiple obstacles such as trees or boulders. Mobile objects are also obstacles. Besides these, tiles can contain movement events, which are executed when a mobile object moves into the tile, and can also stop their movement.

    Although there can be multiple obstacles, only one of them can occupy the tile. Being occupied means that another occupying obstacle can't be placed in the tile. Any number of obstacles that don't occupy can be placed in a tile, whether or not there's an occupying obstacle in the tile.

    Tiles can also contain blocks, which affect movement from one tile to another, rather than the properties of the tile itself. Blocks also affect occupation. This is meant for obstacles that cover multiple tiles separated by a block. There are also motion listeners which receive notifications when a mobile object is placed into this tile, or removed.

    Author:
    Marko Tuominen
    See Also:
    Block, MovementEvent, MotionListener, Obstacle

      • Tile

        protected Tile(java.lang.Class<T> tileType,
    int row,
    int col)
        Constructs a tile with a specific type for neighbors. All neighbors added to the tile must be of this type, including remote neighbors.
        Parameters:
        tileType - tile type for neighbors
        row - the tile's row coordinate
        col - the tile's column coordinate

        Returns:

      • containsCoords

        public abstract Tile containsCoords(double x,
                  double y)
        Gets an approximation of which tile contains the given coordinates. If they're within this tile, returns the tile itself. Otherwise returns one of its neighbors, the one closest to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        this tile if the coordinates are inside it, or the closest neighbor (can be null if there isn't a neighbor in the correct direction)

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection(Tile tile)
        Gets the direction from this tile to another tile. The other tile doesn't need to be a neighbor, so simply iterating the neighbors is insufficient. Coordinates are used for determining the direction. Returns a null if the tiles are of different type.
        Parameters:
        tile - get direction to this tile
        Returns:
        direction to the tile

      • isAdjacent

        public boolean isAdjacent(Tile tile)
        Checks if the given tile is adjacent to this tile. In other words, if the tile is one of the neighbors of this tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - check if this tile is adjacent
        Returns:
        the tiles are adjacent

      • getTerrain

        public Terrain getTerrain()
        Gets this tile's terrain type.
        Returns:
        this tile's terrain type

      • setTerrain

        public void setTerrain(Terrain terrain)
        Sets this tile's terrain type.
        Parameters:
        terrain - set this as the tile's new terrain

      • countNeighbors

        public int countNeighbors()
        Counts this tile's neighbors. Most hexes have six neighbors, and most squares have eight, but those at an edge of a tile grid have less.
        Returns:
        number of neighbors

      • getNeighbor

        public Tile getNeighbor(Direction direction)
        Gets one of the tile's neighbors, identified by a direction. If the tile doesn't have a neighbor to that direction, returns null. This is the case if the requested tile would be outside the tile grid.
        Parameters:
        direction - defines the direction of the requested neighbor
        Returns:
        the requested neighbor, or null

      • getNeighbors

        public Tile[] getNeighbors()
        Copies the tile's neighbors into a new array. The array doesn't include nulls for tiles at the edge of the tile grid.
        Returns:
        neighbors in a new array, without nulls

      • getRemoteNeighbors

        public Tile[] getRemoteNeighbors()
        Gets the tiles that are accessible from this tile even though they're not adjacent.
        Returns:
        remote neighbors in a new array

      • getAccessibleNeighbors

        public Tile[] getAccessibleNeighbors(Direction[] directions)
        Gets the tiles which are accessible from this tile with direction limitation. Limitations are used in combination with asymmetric templates, to determine the directions they can move to without turning in place. Also, remote neighbors are accessible in addition to adjacent tiles. Returns all neighbors to given directions, ignoring null neighbors, as well as remote neighbors, in a single array.
        Parameters:
        directions - get neighbors that are in these directions (all neighbors if null)
        Returns:
        accessible neighbors, with direction limitations, and remote neighbors

      • removeRemoteNeighbor

        public Tile removeRemoteNeighbor(Tile neighbor)
        Removes a tile which is accessible from this tile even though it isn't adjacent.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - remove this remote neighbor
        Returns:
        the removed remote neighbor, if any

        Returns:

      • getByProperty

        public Obstacle getByProperty(AdditionalProperties.Property prop,
                     int offset)
        Gets an obstacle with a given property, if any.
        Parameters:
        prop - get the first obstacle with this property (including child properties)
        offset - number of matching obstacles that are skipped before returning one (zero for the first with the given property)
        Returns:
        first obstacle with the given property, or null if there aren't any
